title: Elizabeth Holmes gets more than 11 years in prison for Theranos scam
description: Ms. Holmes, now a mother to a one-year-old with another child on the way, must report to prison on April 27.

title: US Justice Dept taps independent prosecutor for Trump probes
description: Former war crimes investigator Jack Smith will look into probes on Trump's efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 election and the January 6, 2021 attack on the Capitol, as well as the Mar-a-Lago classified documents investigation.

title: Ticketmaster under fire as Taylor Swift hits out at 'excruciating' ticket sale chaos
description: An overwhelming number of presale buyers crashed Ticketmaster's systems this week with fans struggling to buy tickets. The 'New York Times' reported that the US Justice Department has opened an investigation into Ticketmaster's owner.

title: As end of COP27 nears, tense debates continue about financing impacts of climate crisis
description: The EU has proposed a loss and damage financing mechanism for the most vulnerable countries, in exchange for a commitment to phase out fossil fuels.

title: Hakeem Jeffries launches historic bid to succeed Nancy Pelosi for House Democratic leadership
description: US lawmaker Jeffries launched his bid on Friday, with House Democrats likely to choose the New York Representative in what could be a historic move to elect the first Black person to lead a party in Congress.

title: British government gives go-ahead for nuclear plant development with EDF
description: The British government approved plans for the Sizewell C nuclear plant in the Chancellor of the Exchequer's autumn statement. The French energy giant EDF said the plant would generate about 7% of the UK's electricity needs.

title: Ocean Viking: France denies entry to 123 migrants seeking asylum
description: France has refused entry to scores of asylum-seekers rescued in the Mediterranean, rekindling the EU immigration debate and heightening tensions between France and Italy.

title: From miracle to mirage: Serbia's vaccine factories
description: Launched with much fanfare, production of Covid-19 vaccines never got off the ground, a foregone conclusion given a lack of European markets and Serbian vaccine scepticism.

title: Climate activists pour paint on Charles Ray sculpture in Paris
description: Environmental activists with the group Dernière Rénovation poured orange paint over the outdoor sculpture on Friday, after climate activists in Milan targeted an Andy Warhol work in Milan the same day.

title: The end of an era in Silicon Valley?
description: Netflix, Meta, Amazon, Twitter... once untouchable tech giants have been recording monumental losses on the stock market and are laying people off in droves.

title: Brussels gives green light to satellite constellation Iris²
description: The European communications constellation program, launched in competition with Elon Musk's Starlink and Jeff Bezos's Kuiper, should be operational by the end of 2024.

title: Xi-Trudeau spat: A further deterioration in Canada-China relations
description: A verbal spat between Xi Jinping and Justin Trudeau has exposed the tensions between the two countries. The Canadian prime minister is pushing for democracies to break free from economic dependence on China.

title: Swedish prosecutor confirms Nord Stream leak was sabotage
description: Investigators had already said that preliminary inspections into the September gas leaks had reinforced suspicions of sabotage.

title: Qatar bans beer from World Cup stadiums after U-turn
description: The news that it will not be sold inside or around the perimeter of stadiums was confirmed by Fifa in a terse statement on Friday afternoon.

title: Nancy Pelosi, iconic Democrat, announces withdrawal but not retirement
description: After two decades of leading the Democrats in the House of Representatives, the elected official from California announced on Thursday that she would not run for the next term.

title: French hunters on trial after killing of man mistaken for boar
description: Two years after the death of Franco-British Morgan Keane, two men are on trial for manslaughter in this emblematic French case.

title: UK must swallow bitter pill with new autumn budget
description: The British prime minister and his chancellor of the exchequer presented a budget on Thursday that will save £55 billion a year over the next five years.

title: In Colombia, the dynamic first hundred days of the left in power
description: The country's first leftist president has advanced agricultural and fiscal reforms but is facing a difficult economic situation.

title: World Cup 2022: The true cost of Qatar's air-conditioned stadiums
description: The cooling of the Qatari stadiums, seen as a 'miracle solution' by FIFA, has become emblematic of the World Cup's environmental impact.

title: The political ambitions of Russia's Wagner Group boss
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin – known for his 'troll factories' responsible for electoral interference – is preparing to launch a conservative movement.

title: North Korea test-fires missile with range to hit US mainland, reports Japan
description: Friday's ballistic missile launch is Pyongyang's second in two days and is part of a record-breaking blitz in recent weeks.

title: Biden administration says bin Salman should be granted immunity in Khashoggi lawsuit
description: The court filing says Saudi crown prince’s promotion to prime minister meant that he was the sitting head of government at the time of the murder and therefore immune.

title: Under pressure from France's right, Macron wants to harden his government's stance on immigration
description: After taking in 234 migrants on the 'Ocean Viking' humanitarian ship and proposing to create a residence permit for 'jobs in demand,' the government is under pressure from France's right and far-right to tighten its stance on immigration.

title: In Brazil, Lula's numerous slip-ups before taking office in January
description: The left-wing president-elect is facing a more difficult transition than expected.

title: Midterm results: CA Democratic Rep. Porter reelected; CO Republican Rep. Boebert likely headed to recount
description: With Porter's victory, Republicans will hold 218 seats next year, Democrats 212. Counting is not yet finished in a handful of other undecided races.

title: Twitter exodus begins after 'hardcore' ultimatum
description: Elon Musk demanded staff choose between working intense, long hours, or losing their jobs. The troubled social media network's management told employees Thursday that offices were temporarily closed and inaccessible, even with a badge.

title: Prosecution rests its case at Harvey Weinstein Los Angeles trial
description: After four weeks of testimony from 44 witnesses, the jurors will get Thanksgiving week off and return for testimony by defense witnesses on Nov. 28. Weinstein is two years into a 23-year sentence for his conviction in New York.

title: The war in Ukraine, a major 'third nuclear age' crisis
description: On November 9, President Macron clarified his assessment of the French deterrence policy, in view of the war in Ukraine.

title: US: Maryland probe finds 158 abusive priests, over 600 victims identified
description: Both boys and girls were sexually and physically abused, according to the court filing on Thursday, with ages ranging from preschool through young adulthood.
